articles.headline: Road map for the future
articles.summary: Brant Houston discusses the future of training journalists in computer-assisted reporting, addressing past challenges and proposing a roadmap for the integration of advanced CAR into newsrooms.

articles.headline: Error Free Goof-proofing CAR
articles.summary: Ronald Campbell shares insights and tips on avoiding errors in computer-assisted reporting, emphasizing the importance of training and careful analysis to prevent common mistakes.

articles.headline: A Beginner's Lesson in Teaching CAR
articles.summary: Charles Davis reflects on his first semester teaching computer-assisted reporting to undergraduate students, sharing lessons learned and strategies for sparking interest and understanding in a classroom setting.

articles.headline: What Teaching is Really Like
articles.summary: Jeff South and Steve Doig discuss their experiences transitioning from newsroom veterans to journalism professors, highlighting the challenges and rewards of teaching computer-assisted reporting.

articles.headline: Taming Crime Statistics
articles.summary: Jere Downs describes a project analyzing crime statistics across Philadelphia suburbs, emphasizing the importance of context and accuracy in reporting crime trends.

articles.headline: Military Hospitals Report
articles.summary: An investigation by the Dayton Daily News into military hospitals reveals issues with unlicensed doctors and a lack of accountability for medical errors, using various databases to highlight systemic problems.

articles.headline: CAR Down Under
articles.summary: Stephen Quinn explores the status of computer-assisted reporting in Australian journalism, noting the slow adoption of CAR techniques and advocating for greater training and integration.
